member.summary: MyMultiplayerComponent lives in sandbox, this interface provides access to it.

member.name: P:VRage.Components.Entity.CubeGrid.IMyMultiplayerComponent.ShouldStreamEntityObjectBuilder
member.summary:
Specifies whether the entity object builder should be streamed to the client.
When set to true, object builder is generated and serialized on the server and then streamed to the client. Client then deserialized object builder and loads the entity from it.
When set to false, only entity id is streamed to the client. Client then verifies if an entity having this entity id exists.

member.name: T:VRage.Components.Physics.MyPhysicsConstraintGroup
member.summary: Group of physics components connected by constraints.
member.remarks:
Each constraint is associated with the connection of two instances. These components can either be on an entity with a component, or in one of it's children.
The group is a tiered group, with the main tier being the one containing the entities with a component, and the child tier the entities containing the component.

member.name: F:VRage.Game.Components.MyComponentAttribute.CommonRoot
member.summary:
Whether this component is an CommonRoot for other components. When discovering what is the original parent for unique components this step will be ignored.
Beware that this defaults to true for components that are not annotated at all!

member.name: F:VRage.Game.Components.MyComponentAttribute.ForceUnique
member.summary:
Force this component to be unique. If the parent class was not marked unique this will force this component to be marked so and set it as the common root for it's children.
If this component was already unique this will NOT have any effect. This is also ignored is used in conjunction with CommonRoot.

member.summary: This component provides a unified event bus for entities. Events are identified by string names.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Components.MyComponentEventBus.AddListener(System.String,System.Action{System.String})
member.summary:
Add a listener to the event bus.
The event bus requires the existence of a provider for the requested event in order to hook it.
The event bus also will never register the same event twice, this is provided as a convenience to the caller to facilitate automated hooking.
member.returns: Whether the event listener was added.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Components.MyComponentEventBus.FindProvider(System.String)
member.summary:
Find a provider for a given event.
This verifies that such provider exists and also logs if multiple sources provide the same event.
member.returns: Whether the event is provided.

member.name: T:VRage.Game.Definitions.MyDefinitionHandler
member.summary:
Handler for a definition type.
The handler is a container for methods related to definition loading and post-processing.
It has entry points in case any additional steps are required for loading some definition.
In most cases the default implementation is fine.

member.summary: Weather this instance has an implementation for the unload method.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Definitions.MyDefinitionHandler.BeforeLoad(VRage.Game.MyDefinitionSet)
member.summary:
Called before definitions a given type are loaded.
This should be used to setup any static meta information related to those definitions.
Default implementation is guaranteed not to do anything. You don't have to call it.

member.summary:

Default implementation is guaranteed not to do anything. You don't have to call it.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Definitions.MyDefinitionHandler.Unload(VRage.Game.MyDefinitionSet)
member.summary:
Called when definitions are being unloaded.
Default implementation is guaranteed not to do anything. You don't have to call it.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Definitions.MyDefinitionHandler.HandleOverride(VRage.Game.MyObjectBuilder_DefinitionBase,VRage.Game.MyObjectBuilder_DefinitionBase)
member.summary:
Handle what happens when a mod defines a definition with the same name.
Return null to signal no object should be produced.
Notes: * To preserve OB caching neither builder should be modified. * By default this method returns null if right.Enabled == false, otherwise the merge of left into right. * When merging left to right the Merge flag in right is used to control the process.
member.param: The object builder that was already loaded.
member.returns: The final resulting object builder.

member.summary: Return quad whos face is always looking to the camera. IMPORTANT: This bilboard looks same as point vertexes (point sprites) - horizontal and vertical axes of billboard are always parallel to screen That means, if billboard is in the left-up corner of screen, it won't be distorted by perspective. If will look as 2D quad on screen. As I said, it's same as GPU points.

members.member: Weather this material has layers.

Important!
Due to the geometry in question the slope is stored as the cosine (used in dot product).
Meanwhile the dot product for the latitude yields the cosine of the modulus of the compliment of our angle. This means after the maths are done that what we have is the *sine*, so the latitude is stored as the sine.
Rule group defines a material mappable set of surface rules.

member.name: P:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.StorageId
member.summary:
Unique identifier for this storage.
This identifier is unique for any storage available locally. No assumptions can be made by equal storages on different clients or the same storage across multiple reloads of the game.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Close
member.summary: Close this storage, unloading it's resources.

member.name: P:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Shared
member.summary:
Weather this storage is shared by multiple voxel entities.
Shared storages may not be closed directly.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Copy
member.summary: Create a copy of this storage.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Pin
member.summary:
Pin the storage.
While the storage is pinned it will not be closed, but calls to pin will mark it to close as soon as all pins are disposed.
The pin might not be valid if the storage was already closed. You should always check once you pin the storage that the pin is valid.
member.returns: A storage pin. Must be disposed when no longer in use.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Unpin
member.summary: Unpins the storage, must not be called directly, used by storage pins.

member.name: P:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Closed
member.summary: Whether the storage is closed.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.ReadRange(VRage.Voxels.MyStorageData,VRage.Voxels.MyStorageDataTypeFlags,System.Int32,VRageMath.Vector3I@,VRageMath.Vector3I@,VRage.Game.Voxels.MyVoxelRequestFlags@)
member.summary:
Read a section of storage.
This call accepts a set of request flags that modify how the request is performed and is also used to encode extra information about the operation when completed.
member.param: Where to store the read data.
Types of storage data to red.
Lod level the read is to happen at.
Inclusive max coordinate of the read range.
Set of flags modifying the request.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.IsRangeModified(VRageMath.BoundingBoxI@)
member.summary:
Whether a range of storage has been modified with respect to the storage provider.
If the storage has no provider this method will always return true.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Intersect(VRageMath.BoundingBoxI@,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Check for intersection against storage space bounding box.
When lazy is set to true this method can return intersects when the box is actually contained.
member.returns: Weather the bounding box is disjoint, intersection or contained in the storage volume.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Intersect(VRageMath.LineD@)
member.summary:
Weather a given storage space line intersects the contents of the storage.
If so this method returns an approximation for the shortest interval of the line that contains all intersections.
member.returns: Weather there is an intersection.

member.name: E:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.RangeChanged
member.summary: Please use RangeChanged on voxel base if possible

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.DebugDraw(VRageMath.MatrixD@,VRage.Game.Voxels.MyVoxelDebugDrawMode)
member.summary: Debug draw the storage at the give position orientation and scale.
member.param: World transform for the debug draw.

member.name: P:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.DataProvider
member.summary: The procedural provider of data for this storage, can be null.

member.name: T:VRage.Game.Voxels.MyVoxelRequestFlags
member.summary:
Flags used when requesting voxel materials and content.
These flags allow for optimizations such as avoiding expensive material computations or quickly assigning the whole storage the same material or content.

members.member:
Read range of data.
The data for the request, providing any optimizations that are requested in there.
What optimizations this storage supports, the caller will never request for an optimization the storage does not support.

Intersect line with storage.
Returnas the tightest line interval that does intersect the storage. The precision of this method varies from storage to storage.
The offsets are normalised.

member.name: M:VRage.Definitions.MyDefinitionLoader.LoadFile(VRage.Engine.IApplicationPackage,System.String)
member.summary:
Load all object builders from a file.
Definitions are not created.
This method is thread safe.
member.param: Mod context for the loaded object builders.

member.name: M:VRage.Definitions.MyDefinitionLoader.AddObjectBuilders(VRage.Engine.IApplicationPackage,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{VRage.Game.MyObjectBuilder_DefinitionBase})
member.summary:
Add a set of object builders to the current loading pool.
This method is thread safe.

member.name: M:VRage.Definitions.MyDefinitionLoader.InitAndPostProcess(VRage.Game.MyDefinitionSet)
member.summary: Initialize stored object builders into definitions and post-process them.
member.param: The definition set to merge into.

member.name: M:VRage.Definitions.MyDefinitionLoader.DiscardBuilders
member.summary: Discard all loaded object builders.

members.member:
This method will handle any inheritance specified in a list of object builders.
This process involves indexing the builders and sorting them according to their inheritance graph.
Once builders are sorted we can merge from parent to child, from left to right. Because of the sorting we are guaranteed to process the top-most parents first, meaning we never need to process more than immediate relations.
Handler for the definitions specified by the object builders. Current initializing set.

member.name: M:VRage.Entities.Gravity.MyGravityProviderSystem.GetStrongestNaturalGravityWell(VRageMath.Vector3D,VRage.Entities.Gravity.IMyGravityProvider@)
member.summary: Returns the planet that has the most influential gravity well in the given world point. The most influential gravity well is defined as the planet that has the highest gravity in the point and if no such planet is found, it returns the planet, whose gravity well is the closest to the given point.

member.returns: Planet that has the most influential gravity well in the given world point

member.name: F:VRage.Network.MyEntityReplicable`1.ShouldStreamObjectBuilder
member.summary:
Specifies whether the entity object builder should be streamed to the client.
When set to true, object builder is generated and serialized on the server and then streamed to the client. Client then deserialized object builder and loads the entity from it.
When set to false, only entity id is streamed to the client. Client then verifies if an entity having this entity id exists.

member.name: T:VRage.Scene.GroupFlags
member.summary: Enumeration describing group specific flags.
member.remarks: These flags are global for all instances of a group type.

member.name: F:VRage.Scene.GroupFlags.Persisted
member.summary:
Indicates that instances of the group can be persisted.
Groups with this flag will be persisted if their property is true.

member.name: F:VRage.Scene.GroupFlags.AlwaysConnected
member.summary: Signals that a group cannot contain more than one connected component.
member.remarks:
When more than one component results of some operation on a group of this type it gets split to it's connected components.
This type of group also does not allow instances with a single vertex.

member.name: F:VRage.Scene.GroupFlags.NoSingleVertex
member.summary: Signals that groups of this type must have at least two connected entities.

member.name: F:VRage.Scene.GroupFlags.Synchronized
member.summary: Signals that a group is synchronized from server to clients.
member.remarks:
Synchronized groups can only be instantiated to the server, and entities contained in those groups are always replicated together to clients.
Groups without this flag can be instantiated either on client or server, and will only execute their logic locally.

member.name: F:VRage.Scene.GroupFlags.Default
member.summary: Default set of flags for groups that do not explicitly specify them.

member.name: T:VRage.Scene.GroupId
member.summary: Identifier for a group.

member.name: T:VRage.Scene.IMySceneComponent
member.summary: Interface defining a scene component.
member.remarks: Scene components are global objects that coordinate specific types of functionality in the scene. Usually scene components hold any code that is global to the scene, but that is not necessarily global to all scenes in a given application. They are also frequently used to share functionality for specific entity components, functioning somewhat like a , but one that implicitly contains all instances of that component in the scene.

member.summary:
Invoked right after all contents of target group have been merged into this, and before that group is removed from scene.
No Add/Remove events are fired during merge. All data is transferred directly and any additional work must be performed here.
member.param: The group that is being merged into this.

member.summary:

member.name: M:VRage.Scene.MyGroup.IsMoreRelevantThan(VRage.Scene.MyGroup)
member.summary:
Whether this group is more relevant than the target group.
This is used for instance when groups are being merged, to decide which instance will be preserved.
member.remarks:
This comparison does not need to be transitive.
The default implementation selects the graph with the most edges.

member.name: T:VRage.Scene.MyGroupSynchronizationExtensions
member.summary: Helper class containing the extension methods used to perform the post-replication synchronization of groups.
member.remarks:
This class contains extension methods and RPCs used to synchronize group changes on the level of the basic group operations: * AddEntity * RemoveEntity * AddLink * RemoveLink * AddDataLink * AddMultiLink * RemoveMultiLink * Merge
The Split operation is handled by the group directly.

member.name: T:VRage.Session.MySessionDelta
member.summary: Snapshot of a scene.

remarks.para: The scene snapshot is not the same as the scenes object builder. The object builder captures the current state of the scene, whereas the snapshot works with the persistence components to collect all of the data about the current session.

This snapshot is called incremental because it does not contain any data that has not been modified since it was last saved. To make a complete snapshot of the scene one would need to combine all files stored in the snapshot path with the data in the snapshot itself.

member.summary: Name of the session, as shown in load screen, etc.

member.summary: Path where unmodified data is stored for this snapshot.

member.summary: Date and time this snapshot was collected.

member.summary: Log to be used when persisting this snapshot.

member.summary: Mapping of save files to their temporary file names.

member.summary: Set of file paths that have been deleted.

member.summary: Files and Directories that should be ignored by the snapshot.

member.summary: Save this snapshot to the target path.

remarks.para: All of the existing scene data is also copied to the destination in addition to the deltas contained in this snapshot.
When saving a snapshot for a loaded scene use the scene's instead. Otherwise any persistence components in there may end up unaware of the save and run out of sync with the in-disk state.

members.member:
Lod controller for voxel meshes implemented in the fashion of the classic clipmap paper.
The original paper: https://web.archive.org/web/20160428150805/http://www.cs.virginia.edu/~gfx/Courses/2002/BigData/papers/Texturing/Clipmap.pdf
This implementation extends the ideas presented in the paper to 3 dimensions and manages a mesh 'sewing' process that joins the boundaries between meshes.

members.member:
Cell cached used by this clipmap. Can be null.
The clipmap uses this cache both for storing recently used meshes in case they may be needed again and also when pre-fetching. If no cache is provided pre-fetching will be disabled.

Schedule stitching for a given cell.
If the cell is a cell in the back of it's lod then additional jobs are scheduled to stitch it to the LODs above. Because these jobs all modify the same cell, they are all scheduled as a group in a compound stitch job.
member.param: The coordinate of the cell to be stitched.

members.member:
Manages a clipmap ring.
The clipmap is comprised of concentric 'rings' (actually they are thick walled boxes, but the original paper calls the rings in the 2D case).
Each ring contains meshes of a specific level of detail.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.m_cells
member.summary: Set of visible cells belonging to this ring.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.m_cellsRemove
member.summary: Set of cells that will be removed upon the current update.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.m_cellsAdd
member.summary: Set of cells that will be added during the current update.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.m_cellsReStitch
member.summary: Set of cells that will be re-stitched as a result of their forward cells having changed.

member.summary: Last bounds of this ring.

member.summary: Cached bounds of the ring immediately inside this.

member.summary: Whether the bounds of this ring have changes in the last update.

member.summary: Update this ring with respect to the world space position of the camera.

member.summary:
Dispatch all changes related to re-stitching.
This have to happen after all changes have been processed for all lods, otherwise you may break stitch dependencies.

member.summary: Dispose a cell and it's contents.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.AddCell(VRageMath.Vector3I)
member.summary:
Introduce a new cell.
Newly added cells are calculated, stitched and then post-processed so they can be rendered.
New cells need time to be constructed, as a result they are placed as dependencies for the parent cell which invariably needs to be removed, but will do so only when all children are ready.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.RemoveCell(VRageMath.Vector3I)
member.summary: Remove a cell during update.

member.summary:
Remove the cell right away.
This method is separated from finish remove so we can have more control over what code paths can modify cells at which times.

member.summary: Set the cell to visible when it is finally ready.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.FinishRemove(VRageMath.Vector3I)
member.summary: Hide and delete a cell whose dependencies are finally ready.

member.summary:
Update cell data about a mesh.
When the cell is a back edge cell the mesh will be generated regardless.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.DualContouring.MyDualContouringMesher.Calculate(VRage.Entities.Components.MyVoxelMesherComponent,System.Int32,VRageMath.Vector3I,VRageMath.Vector3I,VRage.Voxels.MyStorageDataTypeFlags,VRage.Game.Voxels.MyVoxelRequestFlags,VRage.Voxels.VrVoxelMesh)
member.summary:
Calculate a voxel mesh.
Given the size sz of the range requested the resulting mesh will have sz -1 vertices (given it's dual nature), and sz -2 quads 9given that quads are dual to vertices.
member.param: The Voxel mesher entity component responsible for this request.
The starting range in voxels for the request.
End range in voxels to use.
Which properties are to be computed.
Request flags to pass onto the data request performed by the contour.
Mesh to store results into, this mesh will be cleared regardless of the result being empty.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.DualContouring.MyDualContouringMesher.GenerateQuads(System.Byte,System.UInt16[],System.Collections.Generic.List{VRage.Game.Voxels.MyVoxelQuad})
member.summary:
Given a vertex configuration determine the quads required to correctly connect those vertices.
To build a cube mask: - assign every vertex in a cube an index equal to its (x,y,z) (dot) (1, 2, 4). - for every corner that has a positive sign, assign the mask bit given by it's index to one. - leave remaining bits in the mask assigned to 0.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.DualContouring.MyDualContouringMesher.EdgeTable
member.summary:
Tells based on a cube iso-configuration which edges are crossed by the isosurface
The standard MC table and diagrams from the original implementations and papers index the cube indices as a rotation in the xy plane: Namely the indices for (0,0), (1,0), (0,1) and (1,1) being 0, 1, 3 and 2 repectivelly.
This can be confusing in many cases where one would expect a mo0re traditional Z curve order. So the table here was re ordered in Z order.
Here is a good page about marching cubes. http://paulbourke.net/geometry/polygonise/
